card.note: On May 2 of this year Al was playing on his first Old Boys Rugby match in Catalina. His first touch on the ball he shanked a kick over the fence and was booed by 150 old boys all at once. /RBuenos Tiempos my friend./RHappy Birthday.
card.author: The Fox family.

card.note: Ive never met a Canadian that I didnt like but that warm inviting smile is what sealed the deal. Plus any guy who will fry some fish, wings and french fries in an alley for neighbors ain't to bad either! Happy 5oth!
card.author: Beth and Miss Claire

card.note: Here is a toast to the guy that not only makes the wine but likes to drink it too. Happy 50th birthday, Alan. Cheers!
card.author: Beth and Miss Claire

card.note: This is where we tell you how special you are. How thoughtful and sensitive you are. We tell you what it's like having you as our neighbor, our friend. It's freaking awesome, your deep fry skills rock, you beautify this crazy fun place we call home and we love you all!
card.author: Reeders

card.note: Dearest Alan/RThe birth of your son, Jackson, I see as the greatest gift and bundle of love you have ever or will ever know. /RI have seen you as a beautiful father and teacher./RJust remember to let Jackson know, rubber boots are for wearing on your feet & nothing else!
card.author: Kim Langille, first cousin. xoxoxox

card.note: Hmmmm.... I think we may have kissed once? Lr Truro, at the old hall. There were parties there once in awhile.... I think. LOL! Enjoy Alan! I am just finishing up my 50th and it is a great place to be! Have a Happy Day! All the Best, Susan
card.author: Susan Connors MacQuarrie

card.note: Alan, I have enjoyed getting to know you more and more! Hope your birthday rocks!
card.author: Leslie Mische

card.note: Life is never boring when you go on a road trip with Al Davis. A few years back in Cabo we were being chased down the beach by the federales one night and the next day he helped pull me up on a boat before I became shark bait./R50 long and going strong! Keep givin er eh!
card.author: Headly J Bluenoser

card.note: Well, there R TMTM. However I'll mention, when I got separated & spent a week w/ Al back in 07, the hospitally that he shared w/ me, helped me move forward. Thx U 4 that, U have no idea what that week meant 2 me. Like good wine brother. Miss U, thx 4 the bike ride.xoxo
card.author: Kevin George Langille

card.note: You are a teacher in the classroom and the alley! I always enjoy talking shop with you!
card.author: Dustin

card.note: It's just gas, Papa.
card.author: Jackson

card.note: Have a wonderful, happy, healthy birthday now and forever. /R/RHappy Birthday!
card.author: With love, Selene & Adam

card.note: I was so surprised and delighted when you replaced the spark plugs in my car and filled the tank. You went through so much trouble for me because you really care and understand how important having a car is to me. I love you very much and wish you a happy 50th.
card.author: Yolanda

card.note: Cherish your memories before you forget them. Have a happy 50th. Love you!
card.author: Gigi and Jackson

card.note: I remember when you went next door to the Grino's driveway and pulled down your pants and had a poo. You could not wait to go. I guess when you gotta go you gotta go! You've come a long way. Happy birthday, son.
card.author: Mom

card.note: When we first met, I was instantly attracted to you. Maybe it was your smile or your warm Canadian accent. But I knew you were the one for me the night we picked up sushi and had our takeout on the cliff in PV. The night was so beautiful and you felt so right. Love you.
card.author: Gigi

card.note: Alan, to wish you an Amazing 50th Birthday. May you have many more years to celebrate with friends and family./R/RYou have always been good to my family and to me and we all appreciate your friendship./R/RSending you lots of happy wishes.
card.author: Judy, Brandon, Melissa, Patrick

card.note: Alan, Alan how can it be.../RThat you are half a century! /RWith Gigi and Jackson by your side, /RYou'll have 50 more years of a magnificent ride! /R/R/R
card.author: xoxox, sister in law, Suzanne.

card.note: Remembering some road trips--just you and I. '37 Ford to New Glasgow car show, you were about 10. '53 Olds to PEI, you were 11 or 12. Remembering you disappeared. Those were good times traveling alone together. Happy 50th!
card.author: Dad

card.note: Traveling the backroads of DeBert, Nutby, Riversdale looking for Christmas tree, skidooing, or just driving in the ’46 Merc truck. How ‘bout your Honda 50 and your Evel Knievel stuff. Shame on you! You’re lucky you’re still here.
card.author: Dad

card.note: ...Then there was Alan, John and Dad trucking to Myrtle Beach. Good memories. Happy Birthday and hoping you have 50 more.
card.author: Dad

card.note: You are a good father and husband. Jackson will want to grow up to be like you. You plant the seeds of love, caring, understanding and dedication. Mr. Alan, feliz cumpleaños.
card.author: Glenda

card.note: I remember when you first bought your Harley, brought it to the house and put Reese on the handlebars. He was only 2 and was smiling to beat the band. You made my son so happy. Having a Harley is something most boys dream about. Happy Birthday!
card.author: Stacey

card.note: Uncle Al, /RWe hope your birthday is " easy peasy lemon squeeze!" /R
card.author: Love Riley and Cash xoxo

card.note: Alan/RLife goes by. And we lose touch. But know your always in my heart. Love you Al./RHappy Birthday/R Brother./R /R
card.author: Johnny
